2:Tbb8,{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Recipe","name":"Flan Casero with Dulce de Leche","description":"Argentina's most popular dessert — a silky, caramel-topped custard served with a generous spoonful of dulce de leche and whipped cream. Found on every restaurant menu in the country.","image":"https://expatsargentina.com/images/recipes/flan-casero.webp","author":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Expats Argentina"},"datePublished":"2025-01-01","prepTime":"PT15M","cookTime":"PT1M","totalTime":"PT16M","recipeYield":"8 servings","recipeCategory":"dessert","recipeCuisine":"Argentine","keywords":"flan casero recipe, argentine flan, flan con dulce de leche, flan recipe easy, argentine dessert","nutrition":{"@type":"NutritionInformation","calories":"280 calories","proteinContent":"8g","carbohydrateContent":"38g","fatContent":"11g"},"recipeIngredient":["Caramel: 200g (1 cup) white sugar","Caramel: 3 tbsp water","Caramel: 1 tsp lemon juice","Custard: 6 large eggs","Custard: 1 liter (4 cups) whole milk","Custard: 200g (1 cup) sugar","Custard: 2 tsp vanilla extract","Custard: Zest of 1 lemon (optional)","Serving: Dulce de leche (generous amount)","Serving: Whipped cream"],"recipeInstructions":[{"@type":"HowToStep","position":1,"text":"Make the caramel: Combine sugar, water, and lemon juice in a saucepan over medium heat."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":2,"text":"Swirl the pan (don't stir) until the sugar turns deep amber, about 5-7 minutes."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":3,"text":"Immediately pour the caramel into a flan mold or individual ramekins, tilting to coat the bottom evenly."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":4,"text":"Let caramel harden while you prepare the custard."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":5,"text":"Heat milk in a saucepan until warm (not boiling). Remove from heat."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":6,"text":"In a large bowl, whisk eggs and sugar together until well combined — don't over-whisk or create foam."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":7,"text":"Slowly pour the warm milk into the egg mixture, stirring constantly."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":8,"text":"Add vanilla and lemon zest. Strain through a fine sieve to remove any lumps."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":9,"text":"Pour the custard into the caramel-lined mold."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":10,"text":"Place the mold in a larger baking dish. Fill the outer dish with hot water to reach halfway up the flan mold (baño María)."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":11,"text":"Bake at 160°C (325°F) for 50-60 minutes until set but slightly jiggly in the center."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":12,"text":"Remove from water bath, cool to room temperature, then refrigerate at least 4 hours."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":13,"text":"To unmold: Run a knife around the edge, place a plate on top, and flip. The caramel will cascade over the flan."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":14,"text":"Serve with a generous spoon of dulce de leche and a dollop of whipped cream."}]}0:{"buildId":"XJ7f5RvYDcX4yjbAXmNYG","rsc":["$","$1","c",{"children":[["$","div",null,{"className":"min-h-screen bg-gradient-to-b from-orange-50 to-white","children":[["$","script",null,{"type":"application/ld+json","dangerouslySetInnerHTML":{"__html":"$2"}}],["$","div",null,{"className":"border-b bg-white/80 backdrop-blur-sm sticky top-0 z-40 print:hidden","children":"$L3"}],"$L4","$L5","$L6"]}],null,"$L7"]}],"loading":null,"isPartial":false}

1b:["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card","className":"text-card-foreground flex flex-col gap-6 rounded-xl border py-6 shadow-sm bg-gradient-to-br from-amber-50 to-orange-50 border-amber-100 print:bg-none print:border-gray-300","id":"tips","children":[["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-header","className":"@container/card-header grid auto-rows-min grid-rows-[auto_auto] items-start gap-2 px-6 has-data-[slot=card-action]:grid-cols-[1fr_auto] [.border-b]:pb-6","children":["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-title","className":"font-semibold flex items-center gap-2 text-xl","children":[["$","svg",null,{"xmlns":"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg","width":24,"height":24,"viewBox":"0 0 24 24","fill":"none","stroke":"currentColor","strokeWidth":2,"strokeLinecap":"round","strokeLinejoin":"round","className":"lucide lucide-lightbulb w-5 h-5 text-amber-600","aria-hidden":"true","children":[["$","path","1gvzjb",{"d":"M15 14c.2-1 .7-1.7 1.5-2.5 1-.9 1.5-2.2 1.5-3.5A6 6 0 0 0 6 8c0 1 .2 2.2 1.5 3.5.7.7 1.3 1.5 1.5 2.5"}],["$","path","x1upvd",{"d":"M9 18h6"}],["$","path","ceow96",{"d":"M10 22h4"}],"$undefined"]}],"Pro Tips from the Kitchen"]}]}],["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-content","className":"px-6","children":["$","ul",null,{"className":"space-y-3","children":[["$","li","0",{"className":"flex items-start gap-3","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"text-amber-500 mt-1","children":"✦"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700","children":"Don't stir the caramel — swirl the pan gently. Stirring causes crystallization."}]]}],["$","li","1",{"className":"flex items-start gap-3","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"text-amber-500 mt-1","children":"✦"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700","children":"Strain the custard to catch any bits of egg that didn't fully incorporate — this is key for silky texture."}]]}],["$","li","2",{"className":"flex items-start gap-3","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"text-amber-500 mt-1","children":"✦"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700","children":"The water bath (baño María) is essential — it prevents the edges from overcooking."}]]}],["$","li","3",{"className":"flex items-start gap-3","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"text-amber-500 mt-1","children":"✦"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700","children":"The flan should wobble like jello when done. If it's firm throughout, it's overcooked."}]]}],["$","li","4",{"className":"flex items-start gap-3","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"text-amber-500 mt-1","children":"✦"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700","children":"When ordering in a restaurant, always say 'mixto' — you want dulce de leche AND crema."}]]}],["$","li","5",{"className":"flex items-start gap-3","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"text-amber-500 mt-1","children":"✦"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700","children":"Chill thoroughly before unmolding — at least 4 hours, ideally overnight."}]]}]]}]}]]}]
1c:["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card","className":"bg-card text-card-foreground flex flex-col gap-6 rounded-xl border py-6 shadow-sm print:shadow-none print:border-gray-300","id":"history","children":[["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-header","className":"@container/card-header grid auto-rows-min grid-rows-[auto_auto] items-start gap-2 px-6 has-data-[slot=card-action]:grid-cols-[1fr_auto] [.border-b]:pb-6","children":["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-title","className":"font-semibold flex items-center gap-2 text-xl","children":[["$","svg",null,{"xmlns":"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg","width":24,"height":24,"viewBox":"0 0 24 24","fill":"none","stroke":"currentColor","strokeWidth":2,"strokeLinecap":"round","strokeLinejoin":"round","className":"lucide lucide-history w-5 h-5 text-orange-600","aria-hidden":"true","children":[["$","path","1357e3",{"d":"M3 12a9 9 0 1 0 9-9 9.75 9.75 0 0 0-6.74 2.74L3 8"}],["$","path","1xhq8a",{"d":"M3 3v5h5"}],["$","path","1fdv2h",{"d":"M12 7v5l4 2"}],"$undefined"]}],"The Story Behind the Dish"]}]}],["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-content","className":"px-6","children":["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700 leading-relaxed","children":"Flan came to Argentina from Spain, but Argentines made it their own by pairing it with their beloved dulce de leche. In restaurants, you'll always be asked the critical question: '¿Mixto?' — meaning 'do you want it with both dulce de leche AND whipped cream?' The correct answer is always yes. Flan casero (homemade) is a point of pride for Argentine home cooks, and every family claims their recipe is the best."}]}]]}]
1d:["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card","className":"bg-card text-card-foreground flex flex-col gap-6 rounded-xl border py-6 shadow-sm print:shadow-none print:border-gray-300","children":[["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-header","className":"@container/card-header grid auto-rows-min grid-rows-[auto_auto] items-start gap-2 px-6 has-data-[slot=card-action]:grid-cols-[1fr_auto] [.border-b]:pb-6 pb-3","children":["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-title","className":"font-semibold text-lg","children":"Storage & Leftovers"}]}],["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-content","className":"px-6 pt-0","children":["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700","children":"Refrigerate for up to 3 days in the mold. Unmold only when ready to serve. Once unmolded, serve within a few hours."}]}]]}]
